doc.previous: The WB-50 had an important role during the Cuban Missile Crisis, when it monitored the weather around Cuba to plan photo-reconnaissance flights. Although weather flying was considered a "peacetime" mission, the hazardous flying in hurricanes took their toll, and claimed 66 lives in thirteen WB-50 accidents over their 10-year history in weather, also being retired in 1965 due to metal fatigue and corrosion.[20][21]
